abstract.text: A color render target that specifies the color configuration and color operations for a render pipeline.

inlineContent.text: object defines the configuration of a color attachment associated with a rendering pipeline.
property must be specified for the rendering pipeline state at the color attachment.

Blend operations determine how a source fragment is combined with a destination value in a color attachment to determine the pixel value to be written. The following properties define whether and how blending is performed:
property enables blending. The default value is
property identifies which color channels are blended. The default value is
, which allows all color channels to be blended.
properties assign the blend operations for RGB and alpha pixel data. The default value for both properties is
properties assign the source and destination blend factors. The default value for

abstract.text: A false value.
Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
The source and destination blend factors are often needed to complete specification of a blend operation. In most cases, the blend factor for both RGB values (
) and alpha values (
) are similar to one another, but in some cases, such as
, the blend factor is slightly different. Four blend factors (

Blend factor of one.
Blend factor of zero.
For every pixel,

determines how to combine and weight the source fragment values with the destination values. Some blend operations multiply the source values by a source blend factor (SBF), multiply the destination values by a destination blend factor (DBF), and then combine the results using addition or subtraction. Other blend operations use either a minimum or maximum function to determine the result.
Add portions of both source and destination pixel values.
Values used to specify a mask to permit or restrict writing to color channels of a color value. The values
, and
select one color channel each, and they can be bitwise combined.
All color channels are enabled.
The alpha color channel is enabled.
The blue color channel is enabled.
The green color channel is enabled.
The red color channel is enabled.
An object that configures new render pipeline state objects for mesh shading.
The mutability options for a buffer that a render or compute pipeline uses.
An array of pipeline buffer descriptors.
Options that determine how Metal prepares the pipeline.
Configures each pixel component value, including alpha, for the render pipeline’s constant blend color.
A color render target that specifies the color configuration and color operations for a render pipeline.
The blend operation assigned for the alpha data.
The destination blend factor (DBF) used by the alpha blend operation.
The destination blend factor (DBF) used by the RGB blend operation.
A Boolean value that determines whether blending is enabled.
The pixel format of the color attachment’s texture.
The blend operation assigned for the RGB data.
The source blend factor (SBF) used by the alpha blend operation.
The source blend factor (SBF) used by the RGB blend operation.
A bitmask that restricts which color channels are written into the texture.
An array of render pipeline color attachment descriptor objects.
An argument of options you pass to a GPU device to get a render pipeline state.
A collection of functions for updating a render pipeline.
An interface that represents a graphics pipeline configuration for a render pass, which the pass applies to the draw commands you encode.
A description of a tile-shading render pipeline’s color render target.
An object that configures new render pipeline state objects for tile shading.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
